docs.snippet: Mr. Xi, at Microsoft headquarters, heard criticism of his government’s laws and practices that discriminate against American corporate operations in China....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Xi, at Microsoft headquarters, heard criticism of his government’s laws and practices that discriminate against American corporate operations in China.
docs.abstract: American industry executives join forum led by commerce secretary Penny Pritzker to discuss issues with China’s Pres Xi Jinping on conducting business in Chinese cyberspace; alleged hacking and thefts of commercial secrets, forced technology transfer and policies that discriminate against them discussed.

headline.main: Xi Jinping Hears Tough Complaints of American Business
headline.print_headline: Chinese Leader Hears Tough Complaints of American Business

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and NICK WINGFIELD

docs.snippet: Plus, how to share iTunes files between computers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Plus, how to share iTunes files between computers.
docs.abstract: Personal Tech Q&A on sharing iTunes files between multiple computers and sizing a photo to fit cover slot on a Facebook profile; Tip of the Week on webmail providers with integrated voice and video chat.

headline.print_headline: Measuring a Photo for Facebook’s Cover

docs.snippet: The luxury buses have become the symbol for a campaign by activists to reclaim a city they say has been appropriated by the tech elite....
docs.lead_paragraph: The luxury buses have become the symbol for a campaign by activists to reclaim a city they say has been appropriated by the tech elite.
docs.abstract: San Francisco transit agency votes to start pilot program to oversee tech company buses and charge them a fee for each stop they make; luxury buses have become symbol for campaign by activists to reclaim a city they say has been appropriated by tech elite.

headline.main: Buses for Tech Workers in San Francisco Will Pay Fee
headline.print_headline: Buses for Tech Workers in San Francisco Will Pay Fee

byline.original: By MALIA WOLLAN and DAVID STREITFELD

docs.snippet: School districts across the country are imposing strict new guidelines that ban private conversations between teachers and their students on cellphones and online platforms....
docs.lead_paragraph: School districts across the country are imposing strict new guidelines that ban private conversations between teachers and their students on cellphones and online platforms.
docs.abstract: School districts across country, faced with scandals and complaints involving teachers who misuse social media, are imposing strict new guidelines that ban private conversations between teachers and their students on cellphones and online platforms like Facebook and Twitter; stricter guidelines are meeting resistance from some teachers because of the increasing importance of technology as a teaching tool and of using social media to engage with students.

headline.seo: Rules to Limit How Teachers and Students Interact Online
headline.main: Rules to Stop Pupil and Teacher From Getting Too Social Online
headline.print_headline: Rules to Stop Pupil and Teacher From Getting Too Social Online

docs.snippet: A Hamburg regulator said on Tuesday that neither the messenger nor its parent company had received individuals’ permission to share digital information....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Hamburg regulator said on Tuesday that neither the messenger nor its parent company had received individuals’ permission to share digital information.
docs.abstract: Hamburg's data protection commissioner orders Facebook to cease collecting and storing data on WhatsApp users in Germany.

headline.main: Facebook Ordered to Stop Collecting Data on WhatsApp Users in Germany
headline.print_headline: German Regulator Orders Facebook to Stop Collecting Data on WhatsApp Users

docs.snippet: Some discussion of an app that can post criticism of one’s work and of Facebook’s new live video push and how users are pushing back....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some discussion of an app that can post criticism of one’s work and of Facebook’s new live video push and how users are pushing back.

headline.main: Mike and John on Annotation Terror and Annoying Video Alerts

byline.original: By MIKE ISAAC and JOHN HERRMAN

docs.snippet: The social network says it will give English-language users in the United States the ability to search the content of Facebook posts to unearth specific bits of information that are currently difficult to find among the more than one trillion post...
docs.abstract: The social network says it will give English-language users in the United States the ability to search the content of Facebook posts to unearth specific bits of information that are currently difficult to find among the more than one trillion posts on the service.

headline.main: Will We Finally Be Able to Search Facebook Posts?

docs.snippet: The government’s longtime firewall had forced Iranians to use special software to access the sites, and it was unclear whether the opening Monday was the result of an official decision or a glitch....
docs.lead_paragraph: The government’s longtime firewall had forced Iranians to use special software to access the sites, and it was unclear whether the opening Monday was the result of an official decision or a glitch.
docs.abstract: Internet users in Iran are surprised to find that they can access Facebook and Twitter without having to evade the government's firewall, which had blocked direct access to the sites for years; it is not immediately clear whether the government has made an official decision to stop blocking the sites.

headline.main: Iranians Gain Access to Facebook and Twitter
headline.print_headline:
Firewall Falls
For Iranians
On Social Sites

docs.snippet: Even as the social network furiously backpedaled on its proposal to change its privacy terms, some users said they were carrying through on plans to leave....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even as the social network furiously backpedaled on its proposal to change its privacy terms, some users said they were carrying through on plans to leave.
docs.abstract: Facebook's quick reversal after angering users by posting new privacy terms for its photo-sharing service Instagram may be too little, too late; some users say they are carrying through on plans to leave.

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and NICOLE PERLROTH

docs.snippet: Working on large projects with Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr luring you into a labyrinth of distractions can be incredibly difficult. Here is some advice from authors about keeping the distractions at bay....
docs.abstract: Working on large projects with Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr luring you into a labyrinth of distractions can be incredibly difficult. Here is some advice from authors about keeping the distractions at bay.

headline.main: Some Advice From Authors on Avoiding Online Distractions
